content: the boyd is a chunky bonnet that uses super bulky yarn it s a beginner friendly pattern that looks great on both boys and girls makes a wonderful gift and helps keep little heads cozy and warm during the coldest months bonnets often stay put on babies heads better than a typical beanie so we love them the pattern gives instruction for the classic pixie style and also includes a pattern for optional bear ears but the options for customization are endless add a pom or two make it striped combine several strands of lighter yarn make it with faux fur yarn etc _____________________________ pattern is written in us terms difficulty level motivated beginner*/intermediate *knowledge and comfort with the following stitches is recommended - single_crochet half_double_crochet decrease slip_stitch i do not include detailed instructions for completing individual stitches but there are numerous videos on you tube that are great resources for this information should you need it i m happy to recommend a few should you need them materials - 60-138 grams 45-102 yards big twist natural blend yarn or similar super bulky weight 6 yarn to make gauge - 9 mm m/13 crochet hook - 4 stitch markers optional for placing ears - tapestry needle - scissors pattern includes 7 sizes newborn 13 -14 0-3 months 14 -15 3-6 months 15 -16 6-12 months 16 -18 1-2 years 18 -19 5 3-5 years 19 5 -20 5 6-8 years 20 5 -22 _______________________________ you will have access to 13 page pdf file -
